```{r echo=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(plotly)
library(scales)  # for comma()

# Recompute totals by region and mode
df_regmode <- df_1 %>%
  group_by(Region, Mode) %>%
  summarise(Total = sum(`Sum of Volume`, na.rm = TRUE), .groups="drop")

# Plotly grouped bar with a log-y axis
plot_ly(
  df_regmode,
  x         = ~Region,
  y         = ~Total,
  color     = ~Mode,
  colors    = "Set2",
  type      = "bar",
  text      = ~comma(Total),
  hoverinfo = "text+legend"
) %>%
  layout(
    barmode = "group",
    title   = "Border Crossings by Region and Transportation Mode (Log Scale)",
    xaxis   = list(tickangle = -45),
    yaxis   = list(
                title = "Total Crossings (log scale) by Daily",
                type  = "log"
              ),
    legend = list(title = list(text = "<b>Mode</b>"))
  )
```
**Figure 2.** _Trend of Border Crossings by Region._ 

# Summary:
The bar chart illustrates total border crossings by region, showing Southern Ontario and the Pacific Region as the two most active regions and each has over 30 million crossings. The Greater Toronto Area follows. In contrast, the Quebec, Prairie, Northern Ontario, and Atlantic regions experience progressively fewer crossings, with the Atlantic Region having the lowest total volume. The dominance of Southern Ontario and the Pacific Region suggests that major urban centers and key border points significantly influence travel volumes.

# 4. Warn if any missing

}

# 5. Color palette
pal <- colorNumeric("Reds", domain = df_plot$Volume)

# 6. Build interactive map
leaflet(df_plot) %>%
  addProviderTiles("CartoDB.Positron") %>%
  setView(lng = -95, lat = 55, zoom = 4) %>%
  addCircleMarkers(
    ~lon, ~lat,
    radius      = ~Volume / 800000,
    weight      = 1,
    color       = "white",
    fillColor   = ~pal(Volume),
    fillOpacity = 0.8,
    label       = ~paste0(port_code, ": ", scales::comma(Volume)),
    labelOptions= labelOptions(direction = "auto")
  ) %>%
  addLegend(
    "bottomright",
